subject: SURPRISE--SURPRISE
verse: Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him. (Luke 24: 31)
reflection: Luke tells us that when the two men recognized Jesus they returned to Jerusalem immediately to tell the rest that it IS TRUE HE HAS RISEN! Oswald Chambers said, "Jesus rarely comes where we expect Him; He appears where we least expect Him, and always in the most illogical connections THE ONLY WAY WE CAN KEEP TRUE TO GOD IS BY BEING READY FOR THE LORD'S SURPRISE VISITS.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4-2-2019:

_Then their eyes were opened and they recognized Him._

(Lk. 24:31) FOR MORE OF THE STORY READ LK. 24:13-35

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Luke tells us that when the two men recognized Jesus they

returned to Jerusalem immediately to tell the rest that it IS

TRUE HE HAS RISEN! Oswald Chambers said, "Jesus rarely

comes where we expect Him; He appears where we least

expect Him, and always in the most illogical connections

THE ONLY WAY WE CAN KEEP TRUE TO GOD IS BY BEING READY

FOR THE LORD'S SURPRISE VISITS.

PASTOR AL

subject: MADE FOR GOD'S PURPOSE
verse: Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters. (Colossians 3: 23)
reflection: We tend to categorize our work as either church work or secular. In truth, there is no distinction. God designs each of us in ways that makes our contributions to the kingdom unique and meaningful. Even when we have little choice in where or how we work, God calls us to know Him more fully--HE WILL SHOW US HOW TO SERVE HIM--RIGHT NOW.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/3/3019:

_Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart,_

_as working for the Lord, not for human masters._

(Col. 3:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We tend to categorize our work as either church work

or secular. In truth, there is no distinction. God designs

each of us in ways that makes our contributions to the

kingdom unique and meaningful. Even when we have

little choice in where or how we work, God calls us to

know Him more fully--HE WILL SHOW US HOW TO SERVE

HIM--RIGHT NOW.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: THE GENEROSITY OF GOD
verse: If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault. (James 1: 5)
reflection: "Wisdom through the awful grace of God" IS a remarkable statement. It means that God's grace fills us with AWE and gives us the opportunity to grow in wisdom during life's most difficult moments. REMEMBER James wrote, "If any of you lacks wisdom, you should ask God, who gives generously to all without finding fault, and it will be given to you. " (James 1: 5) JAMES SAYS: THIS WISDOM IS GROWN IN THE SOIL OF HARDSHIP, IN WHICH GOD'S GRACE SHINES BRIGHTER.

subject: TRUST THE FATHER
verse: Before you were born I set you apart. (Jeremiah 1: 5)
reflection: We see that God gave Jeremiah a direct call, "Before you were born I set you apart. (Jeremiah 1: 5) God did protect Jeremiah, but his ministry never thrived, because his people never repented. Jeremiah knew that God did not call him to success but to faithfulness. He trusted the God who called him. Jeremiah shows us the heart of the Father, who yearns for everyone to turn to Him. BEWARE OF GIVING UP TO SOON. OUR EMOTIONS ARE NOT RELIABLE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/5/2019:

read Jer. 1:4-9

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We see that God gave Jeremiah a direct call, "Before

success but to faithfulness. He trusted the God who called

him. Jeremiah shows us the heart of the Father, who yearns

for everyone to turn to Him. BEWARE OF GIVING UP TO SOON.

OUR EMOTIONS ARE NOT RELIABLE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: THE MEANING OF THE CROSS
verse: May I never boast except in the cross of the Lord Jesus Christ. (Galatians 6:14)
reflection: The cross reminds us of a drama of eternal scope. The work of Christ is a story of a loving God who pursues us and invites us to accept His offer of complete forgiveness. Jesus's death is rooted in history. His resurrection conquered and has an eternal impact for all of us. THE CROSS WILL NEVER LOSE ITS MEANING OR POWER.
original_content:
THE VERSE FOR 4/6/2019:

_May I never boast except in the cross of the Lord_

_Jesus Christ. _(Gal. 6:14) READ I COR. 18-31

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The cross reminds us of a drama of eternal scope.The work

of Christ is a story of a loving God who pursues us and

invites us to accept His offer of complete forgiveness. Jesus's

death is rooted in history. His resurrection conquered and has

an eternal impact for all of us. THE CROSS WILL NEVER LOSE ITS

MEANING OR POWER.

subject: HIS PLANS OR OURS ?
verse: Who am I, Lord God. . . that You have brought me this far ? (I Chronicles 17: 16)
reflection: David could have shaken his fist at the sky in anger. He could have pouted or plowed ahead with his own plans. But instead David went on to praise God and affirm his devotion to God. David valued his relationship with God more than his ambition. TRUE SATISFACTION IS FOUND IN YIELDING OURSELVES TO THE WILL OF GOD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/7/2019:

_Who am I, Lord God . . . that You have brought me_

_this far ? _(I Chro. 17:16) read I Chro. 17:1-20

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

David could have shaken his fist at the sky in anger.

He could have pouted or plowed ahead with his own

plans. But instead David went on to praise God and

affirm his devotion to God. David valued his relationship

with God more than his ambition. TRUE SATISFACTION

IS FOUND IN YIELDING OURSELVES TO THE WILL OF GOD.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: IN TRANSITION
verse: We will be with the Lord forever. (I Thessalonians 4: 17)
reflection: On the basis of this verse we give departed believers only a temporary farewell. The transition that we see suggests that we are only changing from one situation to another. Thought life on earth ends for us, we will continue to live forever and better in the next life where Jesus is. So let us encourage one another with these words. "BECAUSE OF JESUS, WE HAVE HOPE AND ARE SURE OF A FOREVER LIFE.
original_content:

_We will be with the Lord forever. _(I Thess. 4:17)

read Jn. 11:17-27

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

On the basis of this verse we give departed believers only

a temporary farewell. The transition that we see suggests

that we are only changing from one situation to another.

Thought life on earth ends for us, we will continue to live

forever and better in the next life where Jesus is. So let us

encourage one another with these words.

"BECAUSE OF JESUS, WE HAVE HOPE AND ARE SURE OF A

FOREVER LIFE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: HAVE FAITH
verse: 4/9/ 2019: In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world. (John 16: 33)
reflection: Troubles may follow us all the days of our lives, but we need not lose heart. . . For our troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory that far outweighs them all. SO let us not fix our eyes on what is seen, but on what is not seen, since what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal. HEAVEN'S DELIGHTS WILL FAR OUTWEIGH EARTH'S DIFFICULTIES.
original_content:

_PASTOR AL_

subject: SPEAKING WORDS OF HEALING
verse: 19 Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones. (Proverbs 16: 24)
reflection: When God rescued the children of Israel form Egyptian captivity, He promised to lead them to a "land flowing with milk and honey (Exodus 3: 8, 17), a metaphor for abundance. -- God still uses honey to remind us that His ways and words are sweeter than the honeycomb (Psalms 19: 10). SO THEN THE WORDS WE SPEAK SHOULD ALSO BE LIKE THE HONEY WE EAT -- BOTH SWEET AND HEALING.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/10/2019

_Gracious words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul _

_and healing to the bones._ (Pro. 16:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When God rescued the children of Israel form Egyptian

with milk and honey (Ex. 3:8, 17), a metaphor for

abundance. -- God still uses honey to remind us that

His ways and words are sweeter than the honeycomb

(Ps. 19:10). SO THEN THE WORDS WE SPEAK SHOULD ALSO

BE LIKE THE HONEY WE EAT -- BOTH SWEET AND HEALING.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: WHO ARE YOU WORKING FOR?
verse: "For whom am I working, " he said, "and why am I depriving myself of enjoyment?" (Ecclesiastes 4: 8)
reflection: We can learn to work to live AND not live to work by choosing to apportion our time wisely. The Lord can give us this wisdom as we seek Him and trust Him to be our provider. TO SPEND TIME WISELY, LET US INVEST IT IN ETERNITY.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/11/2019: (read Eccl. 4:4-16)

_"For whom am I working," he said, "and why am I_

_depriving myself of enjoyment?" _ (Eccl. 4:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We can learn to work to live AND not live to work by

choosing to apportion our time wisely. The Lord can

give us this wisdom as we seek Him and trust Him to

be our provider. TO SPEND TIME WISELY, LET US INVEST

IT IN ETERNITY.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: RESISTING THE TRAP
verse: 19 Sin is crouching on your door; it desires to have you, you must rule over it. (Genesis 4: 7)
reflection: Sin may try to entice us by tempting us with a new experience, convincing us that right doesn't matter, or appealing to our physical senses. However, there is a way for us to rule over sin instead of letting it consume our lives. The Bible says, "Walk by the spirit, and you will not gratify the desires of the flesh. (Galatians 5: 16). When we face temptation we don't face it alone. We face it with supernatural assistance. RELYING ON GOD'S SPIRIT SUPPLIES THE POWER TO LIVE FOR HIM AND OTHERS.
original_content:

subject: TIME FOR A HEART CHECK ?
verse: Where your treasure is, there your heart will be also. (Luke 12: 34)
reflection: Our choices are truly revealing. Of course, God doesn't need to wait to see our choices in order for Him to know what's in our hearts. Yes the things that occupy our time and attention are telling. Regardless of what we want Him to think of us, the true condition of our heart becomes clear based on how we use our time, money, and talents. When we invest these things in things He cares about, THEN IT REVEALS THAT OUR HEARTS ARE IN TUNE WITH HIS.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/13/2019:

_Where your treasure is, there your heart will be also_.

(Lk. 12:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our choices are truly revealing. Of course, God doesn't need

to wait to see our choices in order for Him to know what's in

our hearts. Yes the things that occupy our time and attention

are telling. Regardless of what we want Him to think of us,

the true condition of our heart becomes clear based on how

we use our time, money, and talents. When we invest these

things in things He cares about, THEN IT REVEALS THAT OUR HEARTS

ARE IN TUNE WITH HIS.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: A GREAT SACRIFICE
verse: The Lord Jesus Christ. . . gave Himself for our sins to rescue us. (Galatians 1: 3-4)
reflection: There is something very moving about self-sacrifice. The greatest example of that can be found in Christ Himself. Jesus's offering of Himself on our behalf is the measure of His love for us. That willing sacrifice continues to rescue men and women AND OFFER ASSURANCE OF ETERNITY WITH HIM

subject: UNFAILINGLY RELIABLE
verse: 19 We do not know what to do, but our eyes are on You. (2 Chronicles 20: 12)
reflection: Life can ambush us with overwhelming challenges. Yet our fear and uncertainties give us the opportunity to turn to our all powerful God. He specialties in the unconventional. Our Lord is not the source of confusion, or fear, but strength and peace. We can exchange out panicky plans for His amazing answers. OUR GOD IS NEVER PREDICTABLE, BUT HE IS UNFAILINGLY RELIABLE.

RELIABLE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: DEVOTED TO THE WORD
verse: Every day they continued to meet together (Acts 2: 46)
reflection: What a joy it can be to meet together with others in worship and fellowship with those of like mindedness. Praying and worshiping together, studying the Scriptures together, and caring for one another are essential for our spiritual growth and unity as believers. WORSHIPING TOGETHER BRINGS STRENGTH AND JOY.

subject: PRECIOUS IN HIS EYES
verse: (The Lord said) "Whoever touches you touches the apple of My eye." (Zech. 2:8)
reflection: Our eyes are precious and fragile, they need protecting, and that's. how the Lord loves and wants to protect His people, by holding them close to His heart. The Lord who dwells in our midst pours out His love on us--even, amazingly, far more than a loving mother who does all she can for an ailing child. A PARENT'S LOVE FOR A CHILD REFLECTS OUR FATHER'S LOVE FOR US.

subject: HUNGRY FOR THE GOOD NEWS
verse: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. (Psalms 42: 2)
reflection: Today there are many who know that the idols of fame, money, and relationships can't fill the void in their souls. The living God has revealed Himself through Jesus, the only One who gives us meaning and fulfillment. BENEATH ALL OUR LONGINGS IS A DEEP DESIRE FOR GOD.

subject: GOD'S WAY
verse: They were to carry on their shoulders the holy things, for which they were responsible. (Num. 7: 9)
reflection: God has different plans for all of us. We might feel that others have an easier assignment, or a more glamorous role to play. BUT if our loving Father has handpicked us for our task, who are we to whisper, "I can't do this"? GOD USES ORDINARY PEOPLE TO CARRY OUT HIS EXTRAORDINARY PLANS.

subject: HAVE A BLESSED EASTER
verse: The sting of death is sin. . . But thanks be to God He give us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. I Corinthians 15: 56-57
reflection: From His throne in heaven, He came to a mange in Bethlehem; From the mange in Bethlehem, He became a carpenter's son; From a carpenter's son, He became a traveling missionary; From a traveling missionary, He became a sacrifice for our sins; From His death on the cross, He was taken to a borrowed tomb; From the tomb His rose again, that we may have eternal life; HALLELUJAH WHAT A SAVIOR! ! !

subject: THE SPIRIT DELIVERS
verse: The Spirit helps us in our weakness, we do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us through wordless groans. (Romans 8: 26)
reflection: Be encouraged that God hears us when we pray and He knows our deepest needs. WHEN YOU CAN'T PUT YOUR PRAYERS INTO WORDS, REMEMBER GOD HEARS YOUR HEART.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: GOD'S ENDURING WORD
verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away. (Matthew 24: 35)
reflection: As we face devastating experiences, we can define them either in terms of despair or of hope. BECAUSE God will not abandon us to our circumstances, we can confidently choose hope. HIS ENDURING WORD ASSURES US OF HIS UNFAILING LOVE.

subject: RELIEF FOR THE TROUBLED
verse: God will give relief to the troubled. (2 Thessalonians 1: 7)
reflection: There is Someone who is strong and good, and who will one day right the wrongs in our world. When Jesus returns, He will come down from heaven with a group of powerful angels. He will give relief to you who are troubled, and He will not ignore those who have created problems for His children (1 Thessalonians 1: 6-7) UNTIL THAT DAY, JESUS WANTS US TO STAND FIRM AND HAVE COURAGE.

subject: GREATER THaN ARE TROUBLES
verse: You, Lord, are my lamp, the Lord turns my darkness into light. (2 Sam. 22:29)
reflection: Perhaps we identify with David's struggles because he, like us, was far from perfect. Yet he knew that God was greater than the chaotic parts of his life. With David we can say, "As for God, His way is perfect: the Lord's Word is flawless, He shields all who take refuge in Him (vs. 31) AND THAT INCLUDES US!

subject: MEANT TO BE UNDERSTOOD
verse: Everything that was written in the past, was written to teach us. (Romans 15: 4)
reflection: God has given us the Scriptures for our instruction and encouragement. He has also given us His Spirit to help us to know His mind. Jesus said He was sending the Spirit to "guide [us] into all truth" (John 16: 13) With the help of the Spirit, we can approach the Bible with confidence, knowing that through its pages God wants us to know Him and His ways. LET US REMEMBER TO READ OUR BIBLES SO WE GET TO KNOW ITS AUTHOR.

subject: PATIENTLY WAITING
verse: What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey Him! (Matthew 8: 27)
reflection: Jesus's disciples well surrounded by a storm, and He used the experience to teach them about the power and faithfulness of God. (Matthew 8: 23-27) We often seek answers for the uncertainties of life. Whether young or old we all face uncertain futures. Heaven answers God's love and goodness encircle us no matter what waits us. WE WAIT AND SEE WHAT GOD WILL DO.

subject: AN AMAZING LOVE
verse: We are to God the pleasing aroma of Christ (2 Corinthians 2: 15)
reflection: When Christians preach the Good News, it is Good News to some and repulsive new to others. Believers recognize the life giving fragrance of the message. To unbelievers, however, it smells foul, it is death--their own. LET US PRAY THAT WE WILL BE UP TO THE TASK OF SHARING THE GOOD NEWS.

subject: DOING RIGHT IN GOD'S EYES
verse: Joash did what was right. . . all the years Jehoiada the priest instructed him. (2 Kings 12: 2)
reflection: We see that the king Joash enjoyed a season of fruitfulness only while under the spiritual counsel of a godly priest. This make us wonder what our legacies will be? Will we continue to grow and develop in our faith throughout our lives, producing fruit? Or will we become distracted by the things of this world and turn to MODERN-DAY idols such as comfort; materialism, and self promotion? LIVING WELL AND DOING RIGHT REQUIRES PERSEVERANCE AND SPIRITUAL DIRECTION.

only while under the spiritual counsel of a godly priest. This

make us wonder what our legacies will be? Will we continue

to grow and develop in our faith throughout our lives,

producing fruit? Or will we become distracted by the things

of this world and turn to MODERN-DAY idols such as comfort;

materialism, and self promotion?

LIVING WELL AND DOING RIGHT REQUIRES PERSEVERANCE AND

SPIRITUAL DIRECTION.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: IN THE BUSINESS OF RENEWING
verse: I have suffered the lose of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ. (Philippians 3: 8)
reflection: Having been trained in Jewish religious law, Paul had been an angry and violent man toward those who followed Christ. (Acts 9: 1-2) After being transformed by Christ, the tangled wreckage of his angry past was transformed into the love of Christ and others. (2 Corinthians 5: 14-17) If you feel that your life is just an accumulation of junk, remember that God has always been in the restoration business When we turn our lives over to Him, He makes us into something new and useful for Him and others.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 5/1/2019:

_I have suffered the lose of all things, and count them as rubbish, _

_that I may gain Christ. _(Phil. 3:8) READ PHIL. 3:1-8

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Having been trained in Jewish religious law, Paul had been an

angry and violent man toward those who followed Christ. (Acts 9:1-2)

After being transformed by Christ, the tangled wreckage of his angry

past was transformed into the love of Christ and others. (2 Cor.
5:14-17)

If you feel that your life is just an accumulation of junk, remember
that

God has always been in the restoration business When we turn our
lives

over to Him, He makes us into something new and useful for Him and
others.

_PASTOR AL_
